page.title: 01GENERAL REVIEW
page.content: This block includes two villages,{ {Linkenholt}and {Faccombe}, situated close to the northern boundary of the County of Hampshire at about 700 feet above sea level, with the small hamlet of {Netherton} in a valley between. The terrain is typical downland country on chalk, rich in wild flora and fauna. Linkenholt and Faccombe are estate villages and people living there are dependant on the estates and are employed in agriculture and related occupations. The population of Faccombe, linkenholt and Netherton on 30th June 1985 was 128, living on 3,742 acres with a Rateable Value of Â£15,640 providing at a 1p. rate Â£150 to the Test Valley Borough Council. This area is one of great natural beauty and the villages and farms are well kept and prosperous.
